timeline.message: EQL: Fix the locale used for number for deterministic functionality

timeline.bodyText: Use the same name for the first argument as in ToNumber.java (value instead of source).
timeline.author: astefan

timeline.bodyText: Did you forget the base here?
timeline.author: astefan

timeline.bodyText: base?
timeline.author: astefan

timeline.bodyText:
base?
And the rest of the class.
timeline.author: astefan

timeline.bodyText: I think we should add a new FunctionDefinition[] array for math/numerical functions.
timeline.author: astefan

replies.bodyText: agreed. @aleksmaus has one in his PR. I wasn't sure if this was math or still string, since it's parsing from strings
replies.author: rw-access

timeline.bodyText: You forgot base.
timeline.author: astefan

timeline.bodyText: Use value instead of source to have a consistent naming throughout the function classes.
timeline.author: astefan

timeline.bodyText:
When can source be a Number? Shouldn't always be a String?
In the function definition you also added the isStringAndExact restriction....
timeline.author: astefan

replies.bodyText: No idea if it's possible, but I can remove this special run-time only handling
replies.author: rw-access

timeline.bodyText:
What if the source string is   0x? (leading whitespaces)
How does the EQL Endpoint work in this case?
timeline.author: astefan

replies.bodyText:
>>> print(eql.parse_expression("number('0x')"))
Traceback (most recent call last):
...
ValueError: invalid literal for int() with base 16: ''
replies.author: rw-access

timeline.bodyText: instanceof Number doesn't match the error message, which talks about an integer.
timeline.author: astefan

timeline.bodyText: Here I would prefer to see in the error message the original base. If that is null because the user didn't provide one, then print radix.
timeline.author: astefan

timeline.bodyText: How are the EQL endpoints dealing with locale?
timeline.author: astefan

replies.bodyText:
Removed locale handling in 4b698eb.
Now the format is effectively consistent with [0-9]+(\.[0-9]+)?
replies.author: rw-access

timeline.bodyText: base missing.

timeline.bodyText: base missing.

timeline.message: EQL: Add more number ToNumberProcessor unit tests
EQL: Remove unnecessary overrides, fix processor methods
EQL: ToNumber renames from PR feedback

timeline.bodyText: Change the src parameter name to match the one of the internal variable - value.
timeline.author: astefan

timeline.bodyText: Same here: change src to value to have a consistent naming.
timeline.author: astefan

timeline.bodyText: I believe we should add a new package for the numeric/math functions. At the moment this is ...function.scalar.string. ES SQL has .math. Probably worth doing the same here. Add a package ...function.scalar.math.
timeline.author: astefan

timeline.bodyText: I think here you are missing the base.
timeline.author: astefan

timeline.bodyText: This should be a two parameters function, no?
timeline.author: astefan

timeline.bodyText: Extra unnecessary empty line.
timeline.author: astefan

timeline.bodyText: nitpick: please, remove the whitespace between the Painless script parameters: {eql}.%s(%s,%s)
timeline.author: astefan

timeline.bodyText: assertNull(process(123, null)) is missing.
timeline.author: astefan

replies.bodyText:
ah. that's because if the base is null, then the base will be autodetected.
I don't know if there's a way to mention that the parameter was not supplied vs it was evaluated as false. I believe substring() and a few other functions have similar behavior
replies.author: rw-access

timeline.message: EQL: Remove painless whitespace for ToNumber.asScript

timeline.bodyText: just curious, why Integer? should we use Long as a base type? Long.valueOf()?
timeline.author: aleksmaus

replies.bodyText: thank you! good catch, I'll update this

timeline.bodyText: same question here as above about Long vs Integer
